string.name: User Name
string.description: This name will appear in network browsers for this device.

string.name: User Description
string.description: This description will appear in network browsers for this device.

int.name: Operating Mode
int.description: There can only be one Master (generator) per Clock ID.

int.name: Custom Clock ID
int.description: This determines which clock ID will be used by the custom clock. If choosing option "Clock Node ID", this clock's own Unique ID will be used. If choosing "User Specified", the user can specify any ID of their choosing which is under their own control.

eventid.name: Custom Clock ID Event Base
eventid.description: 48-bit Unique ID, right padded with ".00.00". Normally, the chosen clocks's 48-bit ID is automatically filled in. When Choosing "Custom User", a custom 48-bit ID, right padded with ".00.00", may be filled in.

string.name: Date and Time
string.description: Current date and time in ISO format, e.g. "1970-12-31T23:59:59".

float.name: Rate
float.description: Current clock rate in resolution of 0.25. Valid range: -512.00 to 511.75.

int.name: Reset to Initial State
int.description: Reset the clock to the "Initial State".

int.name: Reset to Factory Defaults
int.description: Reset the clock to the factory default settings.

segment.name: Initial State
segment.description: These settings define the clock's initial state after power on.

int.name: Initial Date and Time
int.description: The user may choose to set the initial clock date and time to the computer clock or a user specified default date and time.

string.name: Default Date and Time
string.description: Default date and time in ISO format, e.g. "1970-12-31T23:59:59".

float.name: Rate
float.description: Initial clock rate in resolution of 0.25. Valid range: -512.00 to 511.75.
